element.definition: Sets expectations for supported capabilities for questionnaire responses for SDC-conformant systems.
element.name: SDC-Response

element.definition: Identifies when this version of the answer set was created.  Changes whenever the answers are updated.
Sets expectations for supported capabilities for questionnaire responses for SDC-conformant systems.
element.name: SDC-Response
element.short: A structured set of questions and their answers

element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comments: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation. Bundles always have an id, though it is usually a generated UUID.

element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content may not always be associated with version changes to the resource.
A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content.
element.comments: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element as much as possible.
element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created

element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comments: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource  Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

element.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
element.comments: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.
element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

element.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
element.comments: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.
element.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.definition: A business identifier assigned to a particular completed (or partially completed) questionnaire.
element.requirements: Used for tracking, registration and other business purposes.
element.short: Unique id for this set of answers

element.requirements: Needed to allow editing of the questionnaire in a manner that enforces the constraints of the original form.
element.definition: Indicates the Questionnaire resource that defines the form for which answers are being provided.

binding.description: Lifecycle status of the questionnaire response.

element.definition: The lifecycle status of the questionnaire response as a whole.

mapping.map: .statusCode (also whether there's a revisionControlAct - and possibly mood to distinguish "in-progress" from "published)

element.requirements: The information on Questionnaire resources  may possibly be gathered during multiple sessions and altered after considered being finished. Questionnaire resources with just questions may serve as template forms, with the applicable publication statuses.
The subject context must be known.
element.definition: The subject of the questionnaire response.  This could be a patient, organization, practitioner, device, etc.  This is who/what the answers apply to, but is not necessarily the source of information.

element.comments: Mapping a subject's answers to multiple choice options and determining what to put in the textual answer is a matter of interpretation.  Authoring by device would indicate that some portion of the questionnaire had been auto-populated.
element.requirements: Need to know who interpreted the subject's answers to the questions in the questionnaire, and selected the appropriate options for answers.
element.short: Person who received and recorded the answers
element.definition: Person who received the answers to the questions in the QuestionnaireResponse and recorded them in the system.

element.comments: May be different from the update time of the resource itself, because that is the status of the collection and authoring.  This element is optional to allow for systems that may not know the value, however it SHOULD be populated if possible.
element.requirements: Clinicians need to be able to check the date that the information in the questionnaire was collected, to derive the context of the answers.
element.definition: Identifies when this version of the answer set was created.  Changes whenever the answers are updated.
The person who answered the questions about the subject.
element.requirements: When answering questions about a subject that is minor, incapable of answering or an animal, another human source is used to answer the questions.
element.short: The person who answered the questions
element.comments: If not specified, no inference can be made about who provided the data.

element.definition: Encounter during which this set of questionnaire response were collected. When there were multiple encounters, this is the one considered most relevant to the context of the answers.
element.requirements: Some institutions track questionnaires under a specific encounter.
element.short: Primary encounter during which the answers were collected

constraint.human: Groups may either contain questions or groups but not both

element.comments: The Questionnaire itself has one "root" group with the actual contents of the Questionnaire.
element.definition: A group of questions to a possibly similarly grouped set of questions in the questionnaire response.
element.requirements: Need to be able to logically group answers to grouped questions.
element.name: group

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

element.definition: Identifies the group from the Questionnaire that corresponds to this group in the QuestionnaireResponse resource.
element.requirements: Groups can repeat in the answers, so a direct 1..1 correspondence may not exist - requiring correspondence by identifier.

element.definition: Text that is displayed above the contents of the group.
element.requirements: When including text for the questionnaire with the answers, sections may have a section header.
element.comments: On the root group, this is the title of the questionnaire.

element.definition: Additional text for the group, used for display purposes.
element.requirements: When including text for the questionnaire, each section may contain additional explanations are background text.

element.definition: More specific subject this section's answers are about, details the subject given in QuestionnaireResponse.
element.requirements: Sometimes a group of answers is about a specific participant, artifact or piece of information in the patient's care or record, e.g. a specific Problem, RelatedPerson, Allergy etc.
element.short: The subject this group's answers are about

element.definition: A sub-group within a group. The ordering of groups within this group is relevant.
element.requirements: Reports can consist of complex nested groups.

element.definition: Set of questions within this group. The order of questions within the group is relevant.
unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

element.definition: Identifies the question from the Questionnaire that corresponds to this question in the QuestionnaireResponse resource.
element.requirements: Groups can repeat in the answers, so a direct 1..1 correspondence may not exist - requiring correspondence by id.

element.definition: The actual question as shown to the user to prompt them for an answer.
element.requirements: When including text for the questionnaire, each question may contain its actual question display text.
element.short: Text of the question as it is shown to the user

element.definition: The respondent's answer(s) to the question.
element.comments: The value is nested because we cannot have a repeating structure that has variable type.

element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

More complex structures (Attachment, Resource and Quantity) will typically be limited to electronic forms that can expose an appropriate user interface to capture the components and enforce the constraints of a complex data type.  Additional complex types can be introduced through extensions.
element.requirements: Ability to retain a single-valued answer to a question.

binding.description: Code indicating the response provided for a question.

element.definition: The answer (or one of the answers) provided by the respondent to the question.
Nested group, containing nested question for this question. The order of groups within the question is relevant.
element.requirements: It is useful to have "sub-questions", questions which normally appear when certain answers are given and which collect additional details.

publisher: Health Level Seven International (Orders and Observations - Structured Data Capture)
description: Defines how the questionnaire response resource is used to reflect form data within the ONC's Structured Data Capture standard.
name: Structured Data Capture Data Capture
